author: Staff Reporter
text:
Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam MLA from Tiruchendur Anitha R. Radhakrishnan and 68 others were arrested at Udangudi on Monday when they were observing fast in violation of model code of conduct, sources said.

They were on hunger strike at Udangudi bazaar demanding closure of a private fish meal centre which, they claimed, polluted the environment, affecting the people residing in the vicinity of the company. Effluents discharged from the company located at Athiyakurichi village in Udangudi panchayat union had been causing air pollution and affecting the health of people, Mr. Radhakrishnan, who led the fast, said.

The effluent water let out from the company polluted groundwater, and both residents and farmers were suffering in an unhealthy condition prevailing at the village and its surroundings. The contaminated groundwater could neither be used for drinking purpose nor for agriculture, he said.

Tiruchendur Deputy Superintendent of Police V. Gopal said that since no permission was obtained from the Returning Officer of Tiruchendur to observe the fast, they were arrested.

Kulasekarapattinam police have filed cases against them under Sections 143 and 188 of the Indian Penal Code. However, the arrested were released later, the DSP said.
title: 69 held for observing fast without permission
